verses.verse: He <S%H376><s%>, that being often reproved <S%H8433><s%> hardeneth <S%H7185><s%> <S%H8688><s%> his neck <S%H6203><s%>, shall suddenly <S%H6621><s%> be destroyed <S%H7665><s%> <S%H8735><s%>, and that without remedy <S%H4832><s%>.

When the righteous <S%H6662><s%> are in authority <S%H7235><s%> <S%H8800><s%>, the people <S%H5971><s%> rejoice <S%H8055><s%> <S%H8799><s%>: but when the wicked <S%H7563><s%> beareth rule <S%H4910><s%> <S%H8800><s%>, the people <S%H5971><s%> mourn <S%H584><s%> <S%H8735><s%>.

Whoso <S%H376><s%> loveth <S%H157><s%> <S%H8802><s%> wisdom <S%H2451><s%> rejoiceth <S%H8055><s%> <S%H8762><s%> his father <S%H1><s%>: but he that keepeth company <S%H7462><s%> <S%H8802><s%> with harlots <S%H2181><s%> <S%H8802><s%> spendeth <S%H6><s%> <S%H8762><s%> his substance <S%H1952><s%>.

The king <S%H4428><s%> by judgment <S%H4941><s%> establisheth <S%H5975><s%> <S%H8686><s%> the land <S%H776><s%>: but he <S%H376><s%> that receiveth gifts <S%H8641><s%> overthroweth <S%H2040><s%> <S%H8799><s%> it.
A man <S%H1397><s%> that flattereth <S%H2505><s%> <S%H8688><s%> his neighbour <S%H7453><s%> spreadeth <S%H6566><s%> <S%H8802><s%> a net <S%H7568><s%> for his feet <S%H6471><s%>.

In the transgression <S%H6588><s%> of an evil <S%H7451><s%> man <S%H376><s%> there is a snare <S%H4170><s%>: but the righteous <S%H6662><s%> doth sing <S%H7442><s%> <S%H8799><s%> and rejoice <S%H8056><s%>.

The righteous <S%H6662><s%> considereth <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8802><s%> the cause <S%H1779><s%> of the poor <S%H1800><s%>: but the wicked <S%H7563><s%> regardeth <S%H995><s%> <S%H8799><s%> not to know <S%H1847><s%> it.

Scornful <S%H3944><s%> men <S%H582><s%> bring <S%H6315><s%> a city <S%H7151><s%> into a snare <S%H6315><s%> <S%H8686><s%>: but wise <S%H2450><s%> men turn away <S%H7725><s%> <S%H8686><s%> wrath <S%H639><s%>.

If a wise <S%H2450><s%> man <S%H376><s%> contendeth <S%H8199><s%> <S%H8737><s%> with a foolish <S%H191><s%> man <S%H376><s%>, whether he rage <S%H7264><s%> <S%H8804><s%> or laugh <S%H7832><s%> <S%H8804><s%>, there is no rest <S%H5183><s%>.
The bloodthirsty <S%H582><s%> <S%H1818><s%> hate <S%H8130><s%> <S%H8799><s%> the upright <S%H8535><s%>: but the just <S%H3477><s%> seek <S%H1245><s%> <S%H8762><s%> his soul <S%H5315><s%>.
A fool <S%H3684><s%> uttereth <S%H3318><s%> <S%H8686><s%> all his mind <S%H7307><s%>: but a wise <S%H2450><s%> man keepeth <S%H7623><s%> <S%H8762><s%> it in till afterwards <S%H268><s%>.
If a ruler <S%H4910><s%> <S%H8802><s%> hearken <S%H7181><s%> <S%H8688><s%> to lies <S%H1697><s%> <S%H8267><s%>, all his servants <S%H8334><s%> <S%H8764><s%> are wicked <S%H7563><s%>.

The poor <S%H7326><s%> <S%H8802><s%> and the deceitful <S%H8501><s%> man <S%H376><s%> meet together <S%H6298><s%> <S%H8738><s%>: the YY <S%H3068><s%> lighteneth <S%H215><s%> <S%H8688><s%> both <S%H8147><s%> their eyes <S%H5869><s%>.

The king <S%H4428><s%> that faithfully <S%H571><s%> judgeth <S%H8199><s%> <S%H8802><s%> the poor <S%H1800><s%>, his throne <S%H3678><s%> shall be established <S%H3559><s%> <S%H8735><s%> for ever <S%H5703><s%>.

The rod <S%H7626><s%> and reproof <S%H8433><s%> give <S%H5414><s%> <S%H8799><s%> wisdom <S%H2451><s%>: but a child <S%H5288><s%> left <S%H7971><s%> <S%H8794><s%> to himself bringeth his mother <S%H517><s%> to shame <S%H954><s%> <S%H8688><s%>.

When the wicked <S%H7563><s%> are multiplied <S%H7235><s%> <S%H8800><s%>, transgression <S%H6588><s%> increaseht <S%H7235><s%> <S%H8799><s%>: but the righteous <S%H6662><s%> shall see <S%H7200><s%> <S%H8799><s%> their fall <S%H4658><s%>.

Correct <S%H3256><s%> <S%H8761><s%> thy son <S%H1121><s%>, and he shall give thee rest <S%H5117><s%> <S%H8686><s%>; yea, he shall give <S%H5414><s%> <S%H8799><s%> delight <S%H4574><s%> unto thy soul <S%H5315><s%>.
Where there is no vision <S%H2377><s%>, the people <S%H5971><s%> perish <S%H6544><s%> <S%H8735><s%>: but he that keepeth <S%H8104><s%> <S%H8802><s%> the Torah <S%H8451><s%>, happy <S%H835><s%> is he.
A servant <S%H5650><s%> will not be corrected <S%H3256><s%> <S%H8735><s%> by words <S%H1697><s%>: for though he understand <S%H995><s%> <S%H8799><s%> he will not answer <S%H4617><s%>.
Seest <S%H2372><s%> <S%H8804><s%> thou a man <S%H376><s%> that is hasty <S%H213><s%> <S%H8801><s%> in his words <S%H1697><s%>? there is more hope <S%H8615><s%> of a fool <S%H3684><s%> than of him.
He that delicately bringeth up <S%H6445><s%> <S%H8764><s%> his servant <S%H5650><s%> from a child <S%H5290><s%> shall have him become his son <S%H4497><s%> at the length <S%H319><s%>.

An angry <S%H639><s%> man <S%H376><s%> stirreth up <S%H1624><s%> <S%H8762><s%> strife <S%H4066><s%>, and a furious <S%H2534><s%> man <S%H1167><s%> aboundeth in <S%H7227><s%> transgression <S%H6588><s%>.

A man's <S%H120><s%> pride <S%H1346><s%> shall bring him low <S%H8213><s%> <S%H8686><s%>: but honour <S%H3519><s%> shall uphold <S%H8551><s%> <S%H8799><s%> the humble <S%H8217><s%> in spirit <S%H7307><s%>.

Whoso is partner <S%H2505><s%> <S%H8802><s%> with a thief <S%H1590><s%> hateth <S%H8130><s%> <S%H8802><s%> his own soul <S%H5315><s%>: he heareth <S%H8085><s%> <S%H8799><s%> cursing <S%H423><s%>, and bewrayeth <S%H5046><s%> <S%H8686><s%> it not.

The fear <S%H2731><s%> of man <S%H120><s%> bringeth <S%H5414><s%> <S%H8799><s%> a snare <S%H4170><s%>: but whoso putteth his trust <S%H982><s%> <S%H8802><s%> in the YY <S%H3068><s%> shall be safe <S%H7682><s%> <S%H8792><s%>.
Many <S%H7227><s%> seek <S%H1245><s%> <S%H8764><s%> the ruler's <S%H4910><s%> <S%H8802><s%> favour <S%H6440><s%>; but every man's <S%H376><s%> judgment <S%H4941><s%> cometh from the YY <S%H3068><s%>.

An unjust <S%H5766><s%> man <S%H376><s%> is an abomination <S%H8441><s%> to the just <S%H6662><s%>: and he that is upright <S%H3477><s%> in the way <S%H1870><s%> is abomination <S%H8441><s%> to the wicked <S%H7563><s%>.
